creditline: Gift of Robert and Carolyn Nelson
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: black, red and white with gold metallic threads and sequins; central white square with four circular medallions; black border with red organic bands and motifs; heavy embroidered band at center is black with gold embroidery and sequins
medium: Silk, metallic threads, sequins; tied resist dye, embroidery
text: The Khatris, a Muslim community traditionally associated with dyeing, were generally considered to be the finest dyers in Kutch. It was their responsibility to know how to reproduce all the designs of neighboring groups. This striking white-centered design they reserved for their own use.
title: Woman's festival veil (odhani)
